qas.question: What are gender identity, ethnic identity, and occupational identity aspects of?
How one construes oneself now and in the future differs considerably because of what 2 things?
The young child, the adolescent, the young adult and the older adult are phases of what?
The salient experiential markers one uses to define one's past self differ based on the age that one was at what?

plausible_answers.text: gender identity, ethnic identity, occupational identity and so on

qas.question: What are the parts of one's family identity?
What is directed at the totality of one's identity during all phases and all times?
What makes how one construes oneself now and in the future similar?
The phases of what our gender identity, ethnic identity and occupational identity?

context: <b5_0>The inclusiveness of Weinreich's definition<b5_0/> (above) directs attention to the totality of one's identity at a given phase in time, and assists in elucidating component aspects of <a0_0>one's total identity<a0_0/>, such as one's <b4_0>gender identity, ethnic identity, occupational identity and so on<b4_0/>. The definition readily applies to the young child, to the adolescent, to the young adult, and to the older adult in various phases of <a2_0>the <b7_0>life cycle<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Depending on whether one is a young child or an adult at <a3_0>the height of one's powers<a3_0/>, how one construes oneself as one was in the past will refer to very different salient experiential markers. Likewise, how one construes oneself as one aspires to be in the future will differ considerably according to one's <a1_0>age and <b6_0>accumulated experiences<b6_0/><a1_0/>. (Weinreich & Saunderson, (eds) 2003, pp 26–34).
